verses.text: And when they were come to Ecbatane, they came to the house of Raguel, and Sara met them: and after that they had saluted one another, she brought them into the house.
Then said Raguel to Edna his wife, How like \add is this\add* young man to Tobit my cousin!
And Raguel asked them, From whence are you, brethren? To whom they said, \add We are\add* of the sons of Nephthali, \add which are\add* captives in Nineve.
Then he said to them, Do ye know Tobit our kinsman? And they said, We know \add him\add*. Then said he, Is he in good health?
And they said, He is both alive, and in good health: and Tobias said, He is my father.
Then Raguel leaped up, and kissed him, and wept,
and blessed him, and said unto him, \add Thou art\add* the son of an honest and good man. But when he had heard that Tobit was blind, he was sorrowful, and wept.

And \add likewise\add* Edna his wife and Sara his daughter wept. Moreover they entertained them cheerfully; and after that they had killed a ram of the flock, they set store of meat on the table. Then said Tobias to Raphael, Brother Azarias, speak \add of those things\add* of which thou didst talk in the way, and let \add this\add* business be dispatched.
So he communicated the matter with Raguel: and Raguel said to Tobias, Eat and drink, and make merry:
for it is meet that thou shouldest marry my daughter: nevertheless I will declare unto thee the truth.

I have given my daughter \add in marriage\add* to seven men, who died \add that\add* night they came in unto her: nevertheless for the present be merry. But Tobias said, I will eat nothing here, till we agree and swear one to another.
Raguel said, \add Then\add* take her from henceforth according to the manner, for thou art her cousin, and she is thine, and the merciful God give you good success in all \add things\add*.

Then he called his daughter Sara, and she came to her father, and he took her by the hand, and gave her \add to be\add* wife to Tobias, saying, Behold, take her after the law of Moses, and lead \add her\add* away to thy father. And he blessed them;
and called Edna his wife, and took paper, and did write an instrument \add of covenants\add*, and sealed \add it\add*.
After Raguel called his wife Edna, and said unto her, Sister, prepare another chamber, and bring her in \add thither\add*.
Which when she had done as he had bidden \add her\add*, she brought her thither: and she wept, and she received the tears of her daughter, and said unto her,
Be of good comfort, \add my\add* daughter; the Lord of heaven and earth give thee joy for this thy sorrow: be of good comfort, \add my\add* daughter.
